result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vieantay L Lucas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vieantay L Lucas in court.  Attorney Brent D. Nistler in court for Vieantay L Lucas.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney Brent D. Nistler in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means. Defendant's appearance waived by the Court.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for status conference. Case is in DPA posture, defendant has completed TAD evaluation. 
Defense requests Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Vieantay L Lucas in court with attorney Brent D. Nistler.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of the State's offer but no discovery. 
State will follow up with his discovery team to forward to defense counsel 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  
This hearing will held Remotely streamed Live through dacast - Via Zoom. 
Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Brent Nistler

Adjustment Number: 22A 066594,
Payable Number: 1019963,
Receipt Number: 22RP028631,
Amount: $20.00
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-01-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Vieantay L Lucas in court with attorney Brent D. Nistler.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-29-2022 @1:30p
